verses.roman:
ethā tumi vasi' raha, kene yābe ālālanātha?
keha tomā nā śunābe viṣayīra vāt

synonyms: ethā—here; tumi—You; vasi'-residing; raha—kindly stay; kene—why; yābe—shall You go; ālālanātha—to Ālālanātha; keha tomā nā śunābe—no one will inform You; viṣayīra vāt—about the affairs of materialistic persons.
translation: "Kindly stay here at Jagannātha Purī. Why should You go to Ālālanātha? Henceforward, no one will approach You about material affairs."
